an4.61:13.5: When the phrase puttadara is resolved, as at SN 3.10, dara is plural. Also note that this kind of context shows that putta is by default “children” and should be translated as “son” only when required by the context.
an4.61:13.7: I take “pattagata” to mean “what has been gotten”, i.e. possessions. I take “thanagata” as a synonym. ayatanaso is “within means or scope”, i.e. suitable.
